column1: After his retirement, Tolkien went to live [[Woodridings
column2: on the south coast]] of [[England]] to avoid [[Tolkien fandom
column3: fans]]. He informed [[Clyde S. Kilby]] that [[Allen and Unwin
column4: Allen & Unwin]] would forward all his mail, and only a select few would know the actual address.

column1: * It is not implied whether Dr. Kilby was among the selected few, but it can be inferred he was not.
* The address was 19, Lakeside Road, BH13 6 in Poole. The house was known as [[Woodridings]].
* The letter was only partially published in ''The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien''; for other published excerpts cf. [[Letter to Clyde S. Kilby (4 June 1968)]].
